verb.description: Lay hold of (something) with one's hands; reach for and hold.
examples: he leaned forward to take her hand

verb.description: Remove (someone or something) from a particular place.
examples: he took an envelope from his inside pocket

verb.description: Carry or bring with one; convey.
examples: he took along a portfolio of his drawings
the drive takes you through some wonderful scenery
she was advised to take any job offered

verb.description: Consume as food, drink, medicine, or drugs.
examples: take an aspirin and lie down

verb.description: Make, undertake, or perform (an action or task)
examples: he took the oath of office

verb.description: Require or use up (a specified amount of time)
examples: the jury took an hour and a half to find McPherson guilty
it takes me about a quarter of an hour to walk to work

verb.description: (of a plant or seed) take root or begin to grow; germinate.
examples: the fuchsia cuttings had taken and were looking good

verb.description: Have or require as part of the appropriate construction.
examples: verbs that take both the infinitive and the finite clause as their object

noun.description: A scene or sequence of sound or vision photographed or recorded continuously at one time.
examples: he completed a particularly difficult scene in two takes

noun.description: An amount of something gained or acquired from one source or in one session.
An amount of copy set up at one time or by one compositor.

phrases: For years now we have listened to and read about one inquiry after another, about this politician and that politician who was on the take.
Bulgarians are trenchant in their view that their country can no longer be perceived as a lawless, volatile state where every citizen is on the take.
Of course there are people who say that Miller is on the take from someone for his vociferous defense of the this potential ecological nightmare.
Spain's government is under mounting pressure from opposition politicians in Parliament who want to know whether Spanish officials also were on the take.
They made no secret of the fact that they were on the take.
the rest of us take after our mother
May you take after your wonderful parents, and my treasured friends who share your name.
I just hope though that the kids take after their mother.
I took after my mother, at least Pa always told me so.
He was blonde and resembled his mother while his sisters took after their father.
origin: Late Old English tacan get (especially by force), capture, from Old Norse taka grasp, lay hold of, of unknown ultimate origin.
